message.content: Implement the following plan: # Plan: Packmind Promotion After Remediation ## Context Context Evaluator is a marketing tool to help developers understand gaps in their AI agent documentation. After remediation, it can create new **coding standards** (outputType: `"standard"`) and **skills** (outputType: `"skill"`). These artifacts are exactly what [Packmind](https://packmind.com) helps teams manage at scale — centralizing, governing, and distributing the engineering playbook across repos. The goal is to surface a contextual Packmind promotion when these artifacts have been created, making users aware they can go further: manage, distribute, and govern these artifacts with Packmind instead of manually copying markdown files across repos. ## What We're Building Two promotion surfaces (both only shown when standards or skills were created): 1. **In-card banner** — Inside each expanded `RemediationHistoryCard`, below the action summary 2. **Persistent section** — At the bottom of the `RemediateTab`, when any completed remediation produced standards/skills Plus one new modal: - **`PackmindProductTourModal`** — Placeholder iframe container for the embedded product tour (content to be filled later) --- ## Files to Create ### 1. `frontend/src/components/shared/PackmindLogo.tsx` Inline SVG component derived from `frontend/assets/packmind_logo_dark.svg` (already committed). The SVG is a horizontal logo (viewBox `0 0 950 151`) with two colors: - `#9CA2FA` — bracket icon (indigo, matches the app's primary palette) - `#EDE7E2` — "packmind" wordmark (off-white, visible on dark backgrounds) ```tsx export function PackmindLogo({ className }: { className?: string }) { return ( ); } ``` Typical usage: `` (in-card) or `` (persistent section). No need for an `` or asset pipeline since it's an inline component. ### 2. `frontend/src/components/shared/PackmindProductTourModal.tsx` New modal following the existing `Modal.tsx` pattern: - `glass-card` container, fixed z-50 backdrop, close button, escape key - Title: "Packmind Product Tour" with PackmindLogo - Content: Reserved `

planContent: # Plan: Packmind Promotion After Remediation ## Context Context Evaluator is a marketing tool to help developers understand gaps in their AI agent documentation. After remediation, it can create new **coding standards** (outputType: `"standard"`) and **skills** (outputType: `"skill"`). These artifacts are exactly what [Packmind](https://packmind.com) helps teams manage at scale — centralizing, governing, and distributing the engineering playbook across repos. The goal is to surface a contextual Packmind promotion when these artifacts have been created, making users aware they can go further: manage, distribute, and govern these artifacts with Packmind instead of manually copying markdown files across repos. ## What We're Building Two promotion surfaces (both only shown when standards or skills were created): 1. **In-card banner** — Inside each expanded `RemediationHistoryCard`, below the action summary 2. **Persistent section** — At the bottom of the `RemediateTab`, when any completed remediation produced standards/skills Plus one new modal: - **`PackmindProductTourModal`** — Placeholder iframe container for the embedded product tour (content to be filled later) --- ## Files to Create ### 1. `frontend/src/components/shared/PackmindLogo.tsx` Inline SVG component derived from `frontend/assets/packmind_logo_dark.svg` (already committed). The SVG is a horizontal logo (viewBox `0 0 950 151`) with two colors: - `#9CA2FA` — bracket icon (indigo, matches the app's primary palette) - `#EDE7E2` — "packmind" wordmark (off-white, visible on dark backgrounds) ```tsx export function PackmindLogo({ className }: { className?: string }) { return ( ); } ``` Typical usage: `` (in-card) or `` (persistent section). No need for an `` or asset pipeline since it's an inline component. ### 2. `frontend/src/components/shared/PackmindProductTourModal.tsx` New modal following the existing `Modal.tsx` pattern: - `glass-card` container, fixed z-50 backdrop, close button, escape key - Title: "Packmind Product Tour" with PackmindLogo - Content: Reserved `

content.content: Updated task #1 status

content.text:
Here's a summary of what was implemented:

**New files created:**

- `frontend/src/components/shared/PackmindLogo.tsx` — Inline SVG component with the Packmind logo (bracket icon in `#9CA2FA` indigo, wordmark in `#EDE7E2` off-white)
- `frontend/src/components/shared/PackmindProductTourModal.tsx` — Modal with an iframe placeholder and a "Product tour coming soon" fallback

**Modified files:**

- `frontend/src/components/RemediationHistoryCard.tsx` — Added `hasPackmindArtifacts()`, `countPackmindArtifacts()`, and `formatArtifactCount()` helpers. When a remediation is expanded and contains `outputType === "standard"` or `"skill"` actions, an in-card banner appears below the action summary with artifact counts, a link to `packmind.com`, and a "Get product tour" button.

- `frontend/src/components/RemediateTab.tsx` — Added `historyHasPackmindArtifacts()` helper. A persistent section appears below `<RemediationHistory>` whenever any completed remediation in the history produced standards or skills.

- `frontend/src/styles.css` — Added `.packmind-banner` (for the in-card variant) and `.packmind-section` (for the persistent section) CSS classes using the app's existing indigo primary color variable.

rtk git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
Add Packmind promotion after remediation creates standards/skills

Show contextual Packmind banners when remediation produces outputType
"standard" or "skill" artifacts: an in-card banner inside expanded
RemediationHistoryCard and a persistent section at the bottom of
RemediateTab. Both surfaces link to packmind.com and open a
PackmindProductTourModal iframe placeholder.

content.content: ok ✓

content.text:
Committed. The commit includes:

- `PackmindLogo.tsx` — inline SVG component
- `PackmindProductTourModal.tsx` — modal with iframe placeholder
- `RemediationHistoryCard.tsx` — in-card banner with artifact count
- `RemediateTab.tsx` — persistent section at bottom of history
- `styles.css` — `.packmind-banner` and `.packmind-section` classes
The packmind section should be visible when reaching the remediate tab: . And at anytime even after display/hiding elements in the page

content.thinking:
The user wants the Packmind section to always be visible when on the Remediate tab, regardless of whether there are any remediations with standards/skills in the history. Currently it's only shown when `historyHasPackmindArtifacts(remediations)` is true. The user wants it to always appear.

Looking at the screenshot, the remediate tab shows:
1. "Remediation" header card
2. "Past Remediations (2)" collapsed section
3. Empty state for no issues selected

The Packmind section should appear between the Past Remediations and the empty/issue state, always visible.


Now I need to update the RemediateTab component to remove that conditional check so the Packmind section renders unconditionally.

content.text: The condition `historyHasPackmindArtifacts(remediations)` hides the section when no standards/skills exist yet. I need to remove that condition and always show it.
